intro: Cuphea flavovirens, commonly known as the yellow-green cuphea, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Lythraceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to green. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, giving them a slightly fuzzy texture. Cuphea flavovirens is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
